page.title: 02The Cheese Factory
page.content: Lovington Farmhouse Cheesemakers,the only factory in the area,was built in 1968 and employs 9 local people. 18 tons of Farmhouse Cheddar are produced each week from the milk of 14 local farms.Butter is made from the cream. The cheese is manufactured in 4 hours but it must be stored at a temperature of 11C for 7-12 months before it reaches maturity. Whey waste goes to feed pigs on local farms. Care is taken to prevent pollution of the nearby river Brue. Stringent safety measures protect the production team from accidental injury from modern machinery at the 576sq.metre factory. Lovington Cheesemakers display their products at the Royal Bath and West Show and are suppliers to Sainsburys.
